C

check(File) - Method in class sync.Client
This method checks the number of files in a directory, and in its subdirectories, and returns the number of files, useful to know if synchronization is needed
check(File) - Method in class sync.Server
This method is used to check the number of files and folders in the destination folder, it is used to know if files have been added or deleted
check(File, File) - Method in class sync.Sync
This method is called to check if the source folder has been modified since the last synchronization, and return an int so we know what to do
Client - Class in sync
Class for client side of the synchronization, it contains the logic for sending data to the server, and for receiving data from the server.
Client() - Constructor for class sync.Client
 
copyFiles(File[], int, int, File) - Method in class sync.Sync
This method is called to copy the files from the source folder to the destination folder It is recursive, lvl is used to know how deep we are in the folder structure and i is used to know which file we are currently copying

D

delete(File) - Method in class sync.Client
This method is used to delete files and folders that are not in the list of files sent by the server
delete(File) - Method in class sync.Server
This method is used to delete files and folders that are not in the list of files sent by the server
delete(File[], File[]) - Method in class sync.Sync
This method is called to delete the files from the destination folder that are not in the source folder
deleteFolder(File) - Method in class sync.Client
This method is used to delete a folder and its content
deleteFolder(File) - Method in class sync.Server
This method is used to delete a folder and all its content

G

Gui - Class in sync
This class is the GUI for the program, it is used to select the folders to be synchronized
Gui() - Constructor for class sync.Gui
Create the application.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class sync.Gui
Launch the application.

R

receiveFiles(String) - Method in class sync.Client
This method contains the logic to receive data from the server.
receiveFiles(String) - Method in class sync.Server
This method contains the logic to receive data from the server.
run() - Method in class sync.Sync
This method is used to start the sync, it is called when the user clicks on the start button It creates an infinite loop that will periodically check the source folder and the destination folder, and synchronize them if needed

S

send(File) - Method in class sync.Client
This method contains the logic to send data to the server.
send(File) - Method in class sync.Server
This method contains the logic to send data to the server.
Server - Class in sync
Class for server side of the synchronization, it contains for receiving data from the server and for sending data to the server.
Server() - Constructor for class sync.Server
 
startConnection(String, int) - Method in class sync.Client
This method starts the connection with the server, and calls the methods for the synchronization.
startServer(Integer) - Method in class sync.Server
This method starts the server so it can receive data from the client, and calls the methods for the synchronization.
stopConnection() - Method in class sync.Client
This method stops the connection with the server, and closes the streams, helpful for the GUI
stopServer() - Method in class sync.Server
This method is used to stop the server, useful for the GUI
stopSync() - Static method in class sync.Sync
This method is used to stop the sync, it is called when the user clicks on the stop button
sync - package sync
 
Sync - Class in sync
Class for synchronizing two folders on a single computer, it implements Runnable so it can be used in a thread
Sync(String, String) - Constructor for class sync.Sync
